qas.question: What was the accepted length of the Rhine prior to 1932?
Who stated a change of the length of the Rhine?
in 1932 what was the Rhine measurement changed to?
Why was the Rhine measurement changed?
When was the Rhine measurement corrected back to the original?
What year was the German encyclopedia Knaurs Lexikon written?
What year was the typographical error first corrected?
What year was the Dutch Rijkswaterstaat found?
When was the authoritative Brockhaus Enzyklopädie written?

context: Until <b5_0>1932<b5_0/> the generally accepted length of the Rhine was <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>1,230 kilometres<a0_2/><a0_1/> (764 miles)<a0_0/>. In <b6_0><b8_0>1932<b8_0/><b6_0/> the German encyclopedia <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Knaurs Lexikon<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> stated the length as <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>1,320 kilometres<a2_2/><a2_1/> (820 miles)<a2_0/>, presumably <a3_2>a <a3_0><a3_1>typographical error<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. After this number was placed into the authoritative Brockhaus Enzyklopädie, it became generally accepted and found its way into numerous textbooks and official publications. The error was discovered in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b7_0>2010<b7_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, and the Dutch Rijkswaterstaat confirms the length at <b9_0>1,232 kilometres (766 miles)<b9_0/>.[note 1]
